div1.p: Rose sends Carter Noguchi's letter concerning the possible infectious jaundice in Guayaquil.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 15, 1923
div1.opener:

ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
February 15, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a
letter from Doctor Noguchi with reference to the
cases of infectious jaundice which have appeared
this year in Guayaquil, Ecuador. Doctor Pareja
has telegraphed that he has mailed us a report on
the situation. There has not yet been time for
mail to reach us.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H. R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
